abstract: Editorial questions what took so long for disability fraud scheme perpetrated by some Long Island Rail Road retirees to emerge; wonders why not one employee blew the whistle or what caused such an apparent universal collapse of public servants' integrity.
snippet: The government may have filled in some of the blanks over the Long Island Rail Road’s absurdly high rate of retirees on disability benefits. But we still have some questions.
lead_paragraph: The government may have filled in some of the blanks over the Long Island Rail Road’s absurdly high rate of retirees on disability benefits. But we still have some questions.

headline.seo: The L.I.R.R., Retirees and Rubber Stamps
